Package frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems

Class SwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
      • frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems.SwerveDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GyroSwerveDrive
    public class SwerveDrive
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
    Utilizes SwerveWheel subsystems to create a singular, easy-to-use swerve drive.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds
      A class representing the configuration of relative speeds for SwerveDrive in userInputDrive(double, double, double, InputHandler).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive​(SwerveWheel flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rrWheel,
                   double wheelbaseToTrackRatio,
                   SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds swerveDrivingSpeeds)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive.
        Parameters:
        flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        wheelbaseToTrackRatio - The distance between the centers of the left and right wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the front and back wheels
        swerveDrivingSpeeds - The SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds configuration

      • setSwerveDrivingSpeeds

        public void setSwerveDrivingSpeeds​(SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds swerveDrivingSpeeds)

        Parameters:

      • userInputDrive

        public final void userInputDrive​(double strafeX,
                                 double strafeY,
                                 double steering,
                                 InputHandler inputHandler)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given strafing and steering inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +strafeY is forwards and +strafeX is to the right. Inputs are assumed to be from a user-controlled device, so SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds are applied, along with an InputHandler.
        Parameters:
        strafeX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        strafeY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        steering - The steering speed, where a positive value steers clockwise from a top-down point of view
        inputHandler - The InputHandler to be used for converting user inputs into usable outputs.
        See Also:
        steerAndDriveAll(double, double)

      • autoDrive

        public final void autoDrive​(double strafeX,
                            double strafeY,
                            double steering)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given strafing and steering inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +strafeY is forwards and +strafeX is to the right. Inputs are assumed to be generated from a command, so no InputHandlers or SwerveDrive.SwerveDrivingSpeeds are applied to the inputs.
        Parameters:
        strafeX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        strafeY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        steering - The steering speed, where a positive value steers clockwise from a top-down point of view
        See Also:
        steerAndDriveAll(double, double)

      • steerAndDriveAll

        public final void steerAndDriveAll​(double direction,
                                   double speed)
        Steers and drives all wheels in the same direction and with the same speed. targetDirection must use the system where 0 represents steering directly forwards and an increase represents steering further clockwise. speed must be on the interval [0, 1], where 1 represents directly forwards.
        Parameters:
        direction - The target steering direction
        speed - The speed to drive at
        See Also:
        userInputDrive(double, double, double, InputHandler)

      • steerAllWithinRange

        public final boolean steerAllWithinRange​(double direction,
                                         double marginOfError)
        Steers all wheels to a direction within a certain range. Direction and margin of error are measured in degrees. The direction should use a system where zero represents directly forward and an increase in direction represents a further clockwise steering direction from a top-down view.
        Parameters:
        direction - The target steering direction
        marginOfError - The acceptable margin of error
        Returns:
        A boolean, which is true when all wheels are within the range, and false otherwise.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stops all modules immediately.
